question: 逆さま
sourceMnemonic: Something is <kanji>reverse</kanji>, that much you know. The <ja>さま</ja> comes from <ja>様</ja>, which could mean <kanji>manner</kanji>. So, something that is in a "reverse manner," is something that is <vocabulary>upside down</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>逆らう</ja> and <ja>様</ja>, put together. A bit of an <vocabulary>upside down</vocabulary> reading if I do say so myself, but you do what you gotta do.
